variable.name: DIAG_TYP
variable.description: Method of diagnosis - Represents the basis of diagnosis

variable.name: EXACT
variable.description: Type of Date - Diagnosis date qualifier. Indicates the quality of D_DATE.
variable.value: Month, date and year of diagnosis date taken from pathology report or other test report.
Estimated diagnosis date as described in variable D_DATE

variable.name: TOPO
variable.description: Topography - Describes site - Corresponds to first three digits of Topography code WHO ICD-O
variable.value: other and unspecified parts of mouth
pharynx and ill-defined sites in lip, oral cavity and pharynx
rectum, rectosigmoid junction, anal canal and anus, not otherwise specified
other and ill-defined sites within digestive organs and peritoneum
nasal cavities, accessory sinuses, middle ear and inner ear
other and ill-defined sites within respiratory system and intrathoracic organs
connective, subcutaneous and other soft tissues
skin (excludes skin of labia majora, skin of vulva, skin of penis and skin of sctotum)
ovary, fallopian tube and broad ligament
other and unspecified femal genital organs

variable.name: LOCATION
variable.description: Location - Describes subdivision of site or location - Corresponds to fourth digit of Topography code WHO ICD-O

variable.name: HIST
variable.description: Histology or morphology - Descibes cell histopathology - Corresponds to four digit Morphology code WHO ICD-O
variable.comment: The histology code of 9680 = 'Malignant lymphoma" from ICD-0-2

variable.name: BEHAVIOR
variable.description: Behavior - Decribes the degree of malignancy - Corresponds to the fifth digit Behavior code WHO ICD-O
variable.comment: This set contains only cases where BEHAVIOR = 2 or BEHAVIOR = 3. Metastatic code (BEHAVIOR = 6) was not used; rather the 199 topography code (unknown primary site) was used, along with BEHAVIOR = 3.
variable.value: malignant, uncertain whether primary or metastatic site

variable.name: GRADE
variable.description: Grade - Correspnds to Code for Histologic Grading and Differentiation WHO ICD-O
variable.value: Grade II - moderately well-differentiated, moderately differentiated
Grade or differentiation not determined, stated, or applicable

variable.name: ESTRGN
variable.comment: This variable was added to the cancer data collection sheet October 10, 2007
variable.value: unknown or collected on a form that did not contain this variable

variable.name: PRGSTRN
variable.comment: This variable was added to the cancer data collection sheet October 10, 2007
variable.value: unknown or collected on a form that did not contain this variable

variable.name: H2NI
variable.description: HER2NEU (Human Epidermal growth factor Receptor 2) by IHC (immunohistochemistry)
variable.comment: This variable was added to the cancer data collection sheet October 10, 2007
variable.value: unknown or collected on a form that did not contain this variable

variable.name: H2NF
variable.description: HER2NEU (Human Epidermal growth factor Receptor 2) by FISH (Fluorescence in situ hybridization)
variable.comment: This variable was added to the cancer data collection sheet October 10, 2007
variable.value: unknown or collected on a form that did not contain this variable

variable.name: TISSUE_1
variable.comment: This variable was added to the cancer data collection sheet October 10, 2007
variable.value: unknown or collected on a form that did not contain this variable

variable.name: TISSUE_2
variable.comment: This variable was added to the cancer data collection sheet October 10, 2007
variable.value: unknown or collected on a form that did not contain this variable

variable.name: GLEASON
variable.comment: This variable was added to the cancer data collection sheet October 10, 2007
variable.value: unknown or collected on a form that did not contain this variable

variable.name: d_date
variable.description: Diagnosis date of tumor or cancer
variable.comment: Date was taken from pathology reports if available. Date was taken from other records if pathology report was not available or if diagnosis was made before the biopsy. If month and year were available, but not day, the 15th was used as the day, and the variable EXACT = 1. If only the year was available, JULY 4 was used as the month and day, and the variable EXACT = 1. Number of days since exam 1.
